body_html:
Note that there are a number of other inconsistencies. For example:

x = np.ndarray(shape=(3,4), dtype=np.int32)
y = torch.Tensor(3, 4)

x[..., None, :].shape # (3, 1, 4)
y[..., None, :].shape # torch.Size([1, 3, 4])

x[..., None, 2].shape # (3, 1)
y[..., None, 2].shape # torch.Size([1, 4])
body_text:
Note that there are a number of other inconsistencies. For example:
x = np.ndarray(shape=(3,4), dtype=np.int32)
y = torch.Tensor(3, 4)

x[..., None, :].shape # (3, 1, 4)
y[..., None, :].shape # torch.Size([1, 3, 4])

x[..., None, 2].shape # (3, 1)
y[..., None, 2].shape # torch.Size([1, 4])
body:
Note that there are a number of other inconsistencies. For example:

```
x = np.ndarray(shape=(3,4), dtype=np.int32)
y = torch.Tensor(3, 4)

x[..., None, :].shape # (3, 1, 4)
y[..., None, :].shape # torch.Size([1, 3, 4])

x[..., None, 2].shape # (3, 1)
y[..., None, 2].shape # torch.Size([1, 4])
```
